intro: Polybotrya marginata, commonly known as the marginate polybotrya, is a flowering plant native to the wet tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a waxy texture. It thrives in humid environments and is often found growing along riverbanks or in dense undergrowth.
